results.title: Dizzy acrobat
results.creator_credit: Walter Lantz, Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Woody Woodpecker creates absolute mayhem at the circus as he tears through circus tents and upsets the animals, eventually leading the cops to the high wire on a bicycle.

results.title: Divorce and young people
results.creator_credit: Golden Coast Film Productions and Nick Vincent
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the most common fears, conflicts and problems that children face when their parents are going through divorce and demonstrates certain methods of coping with the various emotions that arise. Offers solutions to the problems that children find most difficult to solve in a divorce situation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Golden Coast Film Productions and Nick Vincent

results.title: Divorce = Li Hun [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Wang Haowei
results.brief_description: Set in Beijing in the early thirties, “Li Hun” recounts the cultural conficts faced by a well-natured match-maker caught between Chinese tradition and the Western ideas of marriage and family that are beginning to take hold amongst his friends. Adapted from the original work by the famous drama writer Lao She. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Divorce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
Examines the impact of divorce on both children and adults. Uses the case study of a fictional family to show the problems, adjustments, and critical issues involved when couples decide to get a divorce.

group_siblings.title: Step family
group_siblings.creator_credit: Ronald Floethe, Centron and Gordon-Kerckhoff Productions

results.title: Division (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The partitive and measure aspects of division are introduced when a group of children discuss two sharing situations and begin to make a wall chart. The program changes direction near the end to show children applying the four operations they have considered, to find as many ways of writing “6” as they can discover.

results.title: Divided Germany
results.creator_credit: Matthias Walden and Profil Filmproduktion Report
results.brief_description: The division of Germany and events leading up to it. Originally an administrative partition it became a physical division when a zone was cleared, a concrete wall and watch towers erected. The drain on man power caused by the flight of one in six East Germans resulted in almost total cessation of movement to the West. As long as the wall existed, political tensions could not be relieved.

results.title: Divertimento
results.creator_credit: Verity Films and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: To scientists seeking wider knowledge of the ways and uses of oil, the microscope reveals an unusual world of beauty. Optical devices and cinemicroscopy are used to show oil’s hidden beauty.

results.title: Diverse visions: twelve Australian mid to late career artists
results.brief_description: Artists included are: Charles Blackman, Mike Brown, Ray Crooke, Rosalie Gascoigne, Inge King, Robert Klippel, Les Kossatz, Alun Leach-Jones, John Perceval, Gareth Sansom, Gordon Sheperdson, John Wolseley. Eight of the artists speak about their work on location at an exhibition. Catalogue essay writers speak about the work of the artists unable to appear. The documentary was devised by John Massy.
